TopicTitle: KSP Forums Cities: Skylines Collab. Open to all.

Articles.Content:
Hey, this looks pretty fun.  I'll review the rules and the last few pages and see if I can sneak in a bit of building.   I hope there is some room left!  I'm curious to see everyone's building styles on the same map.

 

Edit: I think I am good to go.  I dl'ed cantab's save just to test, and I think I have it up and running with no problems, no crashes.  I do have distasters, snowfall, and afterdark, so I want to be sure I'm not messing up the save for everyone.  I'll figure that out.

Edited March 25, 2017 by klesh

new save:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=890973091

(got a deathwave spike so it took a bit more time than expected to get some zone refreshed)

- mostly fixed a bus line with a roundabout in the industrial zone
- extended the backward industrial zone truck highway feed bi-directionnal
- extended the farming industrial zone
- added some service (even if not really required)
- dropped some groundwork test road layout for later while waiting for the deathwave to end

 

Edited March 25, 2017 by WinkAllKerb''
btw @ cantab after loading your save i got an broken/duplicate "asset" error msg (prolly some modified stat or a prefab park not sure)

Ok, I have the save now, for a little while...

Match day: Check!

Pearls from the East: Check

Euro-vanilla: Check!

Hope that's everything... Am I supposed to have Stadiums? cuz I don't....

Edit: "Stadiums" not listed as required under Setup in the OP, so, here goes!!

Edited March 25, 2017 by StrandedonEarth

@klesh yes, there's still plenty of open space on the map. Overall based on my area guidelines we'd fit 10 people in no problem, and if it starts getting crowded there's things I can consider.

My recommendation is still to uninstall the un-needed DLCs, although it's probably OK to leave them in, DLC-only features will simply vanish when someone next opens the save without them.

And yes, I've been noticing deathwaves too. They seem to be damping out over the cycles so hopefully we'll be OK, just make sure you provide plenty of deathcare.

@StrandedonEarth indeed Stadiums: European Club Pack, being a paid DLC, is not required. We have the original Stadium and the Match Day Football Stadium, and if desired we can consider getting others with mods or assets.

And that's all the time I get this morning, getting ripped away to go used-car shopping. Tinkered with traffic, added a subway loop within the just-renamed ThrintunVille, incinerators, crematorium. Connected Wink's sewer system; the sewage backup seemed to be easing. Didn't get a chance to look around any more.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=891030256

NEXT!

There still an issue with the sewer i fix it: I Have the Save

New save: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=891066482

anyway it was my fault in the first place, because of the death waves this morning i was late on bringing back the save quick as said and not checked everithing, and stranded in a hurry prolly did the same ^^

Edited March 25, 2017 by WinkAllKerb''

Okay I'll take the file!

 

Cantab, I ended up checking the dlc's off on the library page for the game just to be sure.  I also have "Deluxe Pack" on there, but I don't think that will be an issue.

Be back!

We have a bit of a shipping facility now and a docks for the cruise ships.  I'm missing all the after dark harbor assets!  I'll spice it up lots more later.  Here's the file!

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=891456903

Edited March 26, 2017 by klesh

I HAVE THE SAVE.

I sketched an idea out a bit, hopefully it goes according to plan...

... It turned out less irregular than my practice versions.

I give you hexagons! For a new white collar office park. Maybe those cubicle jockeys will be drawn to an area that looks like their Civ 5/6 campaigns. The outer layer is zoned for forestry, to eventually create a wall of trees around the whole thing.

The demand bars are crying out for a new subdivision somewhere.

Save:  https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=891522851
well, I haven't done this in a while, I'll do it tomorrow...

I have the save

Did a lot of stuff , lot of road details adjustement, will prolly observe what everyone is doing before expanding more now.
 

new save: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=891734067

Edited March 26, 2017 by WinkAllKerb''
next time i m gonna lower density in the botom area, made some test off line, it fix my highway congestion

I have the save!

Here it is:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=891940714

 

Did a ton of work on Long Beach. Connected metro lines to Bamboo Shores and the other nearby city, added a stop on TrainyMcTrainface line as well.  I added a local bus line for Long Beach, but it had a ton of trains, so I dropped the train transportation budget from 100 to 90%. Fee free to do whatever after reviewing the various lines.  We're loosing tons of money, but I suppose thats okay?  Additionally, I also used the Pillar of Industry statue as a sort of Colossus at the entrance to the harbor.  Feel free to delete if that wasn't kosher.

 

 

Here are some screenies, I should probably turn off the depth of field effect.

 

Edited March 26, 2017 by klesh
I'll grab the save now.

Also, I was wondering about the "Paradox Plaza" building, which is a sort of dlc item they give you if you login with your paradox games account. Might be best not to use it if some of us have it and some don't.

it will prolly despawn if someone don't have it.

Edited March 26, 2017 by WinkAllKerb''
on a side not we've reached the vehicle limit

Ok, done, added a bunch of zoning and on/off ramps and a highway connection to the other side. Of course I get dragged away again before really looking around.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=892035240

Edited March 26, 2017 by StrandedonEarth

I'll probably grab the save when I get home tomorrow night! Just a quick question.

Are all the utilities shared among the towns?

Just now, ThaZeus said:

Are all the utilities shared among the towns?

Yes, although I do periodically disconnect Arbor Gardens' electricity to check the capacity of the dams.
I've got the file for a bit.  Gonna tinker a little.

after @klesh I have l’Economie

(the save)

9 minutes ago, StupidAndy said:

after @klesh I have l’Economie

(the save)

Maybe we should discuss this; there is no schedule for this co-op, which I would think means no reservations either. If you aren't actually available for a while when klesh finishes, someone else should be able to play at that point if they want to. Plus it can be much harder to determine whether you're allowed to play right now if anyone in the previous twenty posts may have called the next turn already. Just sit tight and watch for the next save, you'll probably be able to grab it.
okay, but I have nothing to do, so I might as well, but okay
Hebaru is correct. You can certainly request that you get the save next, but it's not really binding on anyone.
okay, ill just do Kerbal, I'll do it later today or tomorrow

Sorry guys.  I'm just bored today so I had time to grab it twice.  I added a bunch of stuff, including a visitor center to the weird Stonehenge thing in Long Beach.  

 

We seem to be in the green moneywise, but a bit stagnant on demand for the 3 types of zones.

 

 

Go!

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=892171127
